questions.value: In need of some cute animal therapy?

intro.value: Every hour we make short clips of zoo and aquarium webcams. We’ve collected all of those clips from all over the world right here in our digital zoo.
Like physical zoos, our zoo is arranged by animal geography. As you scroll, you’ll travel from arctic polar bears to Antarctic penguins with many other species in between.
Click on any video clip to get a link to the full live stream and information about the animals, the facility, how to donate to those animals and more.

methods.value: Zoo and aquarium cameras were collected from Google searches, listicles, and the website Zoo Cameras Around the World. Throughout the day each day, a script runs, launching a headless browser using Microsoft Playwright. This browser navigates to each camera, collects 15 screenshots, and leaves the camera’s page to conserve bandwidth for each facility’s website. The screenshots are then rendered into a GIF using gif-encoder-2. Due to the automatic nature of GIF creation and the reliance on live streams that we do not personally operate or maintain, you may sometimes see some glitchiness. If you see a consistent issue (like a camera appears to be permanently turned off), please let us know at amber@polygraph.cool.

The cameras are arranged on this page based (roughly) on the location of each animal’s natural habitat. Animals with similar natural ranges are grouped together. This may not be completely accurate as some animals (particularly ocean-dwelling animals) have very large natural ranges and some zoo and aquarium exhibits showcase multiple species with slightly different natural ranges.
